title: [Bug] an invalid "Undo" button appears on Deck Overview screen
body:
###### Reproduction Steps

0. (Close AnkiDroid, and restart it)
1. Tap any of the decks on "Decks" screen
2. Tap "SHOW ANSWER"
3. Tap any of the answer buttons
4. Go back to "Decks" screen
5. Tap the deck counts area of the deck (the right side area of the deck's row)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10436072/187925111-afe2eca5-9e3f-4338-a3cd-d55efcd63538.png)
6. Tap "Undo" button
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10436072/187923767-14fe6902-db2c-49d8-9323-3c96102498ba.png)
  _Note: If you tap the deck counts area of the deck before the step 1 above, you can confirm that the "undo" button doesn't exist._
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10436072/187931557-a269e063-3f25-4cd5-9a23-01687d61baee.png)


###### Expected Result
The review above gets undone.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10436072/187925718-c31cca99-0dbe-46fb-a394-8545b7fed36b.png)


###### Actual Result
Nothing happens.  The button doesn't respond when tapped (except for its ripple effect).
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10436072/187926783-c34eb79a-f873-403d-ae72-a58c7e34201b.png)

###### Video
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10436072/187922084-a1c27361-300a-4f25-ab71-c65bea67959d.mp4



###### Debug info
```
AnkiDroid Version = 2.16alpha82

Android Version = 10

Manufacturer = OPPO

Model = CPH2013

Hardware = qcom

Webview User Agent = Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10; CPH2013 Build/QKQ1.200209.002; wv) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/4.0 Chrome/80.0.3987.99 Mobile Safari/537.36

ACRA UUID = 69410480-0b9c-401f-ae8d-94da0f29c9dc

Scheduler = std2

Crash Reports Enabled = true

DatabaseV2 Enabled = true

```


###### Research
*Enter an [x] character to confirm the points below:*

- [x] I have read the [support page](https://ankidroid.org/docs/help.html) and am reporting a bug or enhancement request specific to AnkiDroid
- [x] I have checked the [manual](https://ankidroid.org/docs/manual.html) and the [FAQ](https://github.com/ankidroid/Anki-Android/wiki/FAQ) and could not find a solution to my issue
- [x] I have searched for similar existing issues here and on the user forum
#11220 seems to be a part of this issue.
- [x] (Optional) I have confirmed the issue is not resolved in the latest alpha release ([instructions](https://docs.ankidroid.org/manual.html#betaTesting))
